content: Awesome game, but definitely not easy. It's like a cross between Castlevania:SOTN and Dark Souls. It should be noted that I played with a moga controller, dont know how touch controls are.
I love the game, a truly awesome game indeed.

content: Easily one of the best games I've played in recent years, and one I often come back to, despite finishing it several times. Don't be put off by people saying it's ridiculously hard, it is challenging but by no means unbeatable. Gameplay-wise it's like a Metroidvania title but with a Dark Souls vibe, which works for me. Large, open world, nice variety of enemies, loads of bosses, some of whom have surprising tricks up their sleeves; great game. Many thanks to the developer for the added content.
replyContent: Thanks for the feedback, dlc and continuation will be, I will release them in the ultimate version.

content: This game rocks, I don't get the low ratings, maybe they find it difficult but if you are into metroidvania type games this is perfect.

content: This game is truly a hidden gem, the controls feel a tiny bit clunky but they get the job done, the boss battles so far have been challenging but can easily be beaten with a bit of strategy and some skill.

content: This game is frustrating. I paid for it on sale... kinda wish I hadn't though. But, it isn't so bad. Just frustrating. Controls can be unresponsive, which is the main problem. I also feel like it is too hard to level yourself up. Some enemies kill you in one hit, others dont. Respawning gives inconsistent health and mana refills. Sometimes I only get one health, sometimes three, and same with mana. Just an ok game, but could be better.
A cure for those castlevania needs. I am still early in the game so don't know if it's available afterwards but a map would be nice

I like it a lot. I don't get why people complain on controls they are very fluid. Animations are smooth and fun to watch, difficulty has a good gradual increase that lets you ease into the game. Also No IAP which is awesome.

Exceeded expectations. My kinda game! Love the Castlevania and Metroid style. Hopefully there's a sequel. It's so good to see games like this on mobile and not cash cow games or games riddled with ads. Thank you for making this game :D

Clunky, slow and unresponsive. The timing of the protagonist is way off. Dexterity is punished and bosses have no pattern. This is a slot machine disguised as a platformer. I guess I'm more of a Metroid man than a -vania type.
replyContent: oh you are very attentive! Why should this be the first walkthrough in the screenshot? What are the real problems, buddy?

content: Great game. Had alot of fun. Easy worth the money. I emailed the devs asking where the "secret on portal level 1" is. If anyone can help me out please message, been wanting to find it for ages and no luck.

This game is a Metroidvania style platformer with a Dark Souls flavor to it. It has a steep learning curve just like Dark Souls, but if you stick with it you'll be rolling through enemy attacks with precise timing whilst laying waste to hordes of enemies in no time. No IAPs so the $2.50 up front cost is all you pay for this gem. The controls can be imprecise, but not bad for touchscreen (and there is controller support which I imagine solves this issue). Great job here! Sequel coming I hope?
replyContent: Hi, thanks for the feedback. Yes, the addition will come out as in the game, a new update with new content. So I work on a new game. It will be epic)

content: Amazing game that makes you work for every milestone, but makes every slain boss a personal victory. Amazing gameplay, vast replayability, and troves of secrets to find make this game easily worth the money!
Great game , already finished the game few times. I hope they complete the whole story in this game or a sequel

New controls are much better. Tried free version a while back went to try again but saw paid was on sale. Happy with the purchase. Nice souls like current 2d metrovainia market. Collision detection much improved.

I bought this game for under $2 on sale and am very pleased! No IAP'S, excellent gameplay (bosses are very Castlevania-ish), very responsive controls, great art style and lots of secrets to find! Dev has also updated with more content twice since I bought this 3 days ago! Highly recommend!
Everything is awesome except for the controls and button layout if you don't use a gamepad

content: Finished it. This was a very fun game. Controls are responsive, boss battles can be challenging, environments are a bit repetitive and storyline is basic but I still recommend it to any Souls fan. Glad I played it through, hope you make a sequel!

content: update: hello and thanks for the response. have you thought about geature based controls? tap anywhere for attack, swipe up to jump, swipe across the screen to roll stuff like that. Theres a game called oddmar i think that has controls like that. it frees up screen space also i like the game but the controls are absolutely terrible. you can change the placement but the jump button is 2 times the si pze of the others and it makes placement difficult. bad controls = poor user experience
replyContent: Hey. I tried gesturing. it is not very accurate and requires training and increases complexity. I am thinking of making it possible to reduce the big buttons to give the opportunity to customize more options.

content: I would say this is a good game after I beat the first boss, my only issues however is the seemingly lack of spells and healing being limited to 3 potions unless you buy more, not sure if you get more spells down the line or you are stuck like this but a variaty of spells could go a long way, maybe more elemental spells and a healing spell so you can heal mid battle, its a risk opening the menu for potions which got me killed during a boss fight.
replyContent: Hey. Thank you for your interest in the game. I have been thinking for a long time to make the use of potions and scrolls more than good. and do it. but now I am making a new addition. New locations, new monsters bosses and traps.
